segments.text: I see a woman standing at the sink, completely absorbed in drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even notice the water overflowing and spilling all over the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she just keeps polishing that dish like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s just ignoring it or if she’s really that oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids behind her are sneaking cookies, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she looks while everything around her is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge, and she’s acting like it’s a normal day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I’d be screaming if I saw my kitchen flooding like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But she’s just standing there, completely unfazed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I don’t know whether to laugh or cry at this point.
segments.speaker: PAR
